thread.title: EastEnders lines up collapse horror for Ian Beale | Metro News
thread.title_full: EastEnders lines up collapse horror for Ian Beale | Metro News

author: Duncan Lindsay For Metro.Co.Uk
title: EastEnders lines up collapse horror for Ian Beale | Metro News
text:
Duncan Lindsay for Metro.co.uk Monday 20 Feb 2017 11:58 pm (Picture: BBC) 
Ian Beale’s health continues to prove a major concern in EastEnders as the local businessman suffers a collapse – will the scare prompt him to finally confront his symptoms and find out what is wrong with him? Or will he continue to bury his head in the sand? 
With the nurse at his health check having encouraged him to see his GP, Ian has been avoiding making an appointment for his test results and Jane and Dot continue to worry for him. Ian tries to distract himself by making plans for his birthday celebrations but Jane remains insistent that he gets in touch with the surgery. (Picture: BBC) 
As the Vic arrange another theme event, Ian is prepared to get involved in the activities and prepares to run a pancake race with other residents but he is left worried when he receives a message telling him he needs to speak to his doctor about his results. (Picture: BBC) 
Pushing the text to the back of his mind, Ian runs the race but with Kim Fox determined for victory, a competitive Ian pushes himself hard to try and beat her but ends up passing out. (Picture: BBC) 
As Jane finally puts her foot down, she calls the doctor and makes an appointment herself and it is plain to see how worried Ian is about attending. When Jane later finds Ian writing his will, she tries her best to soothe him and put his fears at rest. (Picture: BBC) 
Later, as Ian enjoys birthday drinks, his loved ones gather to celebrate with him and Jane hopes Ian’s mood will be lifted. (Picture: BBC) 
But will there be bad news around the corner for Ian? (Picture: BBC) 
One to watch: Tuesday 28th February at 7:30pm on BBC One. Metro Blogs is a place for opinions. These opinions belong to the author and are not necessarily shared by Metro. More
